name: Fast Tracks: Tokio Race
overview: Tokyo Race: Hot corner" and Difficult turns await you. In anticipation of a program with lots of pretty girls who are dressed with a "touch of nothing" and hang around on some couches, the whole editorial team immediately gathered excitedly in front of our heir. Both a bitter disappointment and a happy surprise should be brought to us: "Tokyo Race" is not (!) The computer implementation of our secret dreams, but a pure car race. . . "Tokyo Race" is a race of the lighter kind as the computer does most of the steering for you. At low speed you hardly have to steer, but the higher the speed, the greater the demands on the driver. The same applies here: Take a TEST DRIVE! You start the race simply by pressing the fire button; RESTORE takes you to a submenu in which you can specify the number of laps to be driven (1.5 or 10), see the entire race track from a bird's eye view or look at the "world rankings". Published in Magic Disk 64 1989/04.
